result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 10:32am 
Defendant Matthew L Brennecke in court.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appears by Zoom-video. ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Novack indicates that there has not been a resolution of the case, and the trial-related dates should remain as calendared.
recess 10:33am 

NEXT:  the January 5th Final Status Conference and the January 9th Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar
Request by attorney to appear by zoom

Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on January 5, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on January 9, 2023 at 08:15 am.
OK for Counsel to appear by zoom

[MK] case called at 10:22am
Defendant Matthew L Brennecke in court. Attorney Gregg Novack appears by Zoom videoconference. DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Novack indicates that a plea-offer was received yesterday; he believes the offer will be rejected, however it is hoped that negotiation will continue.  The Defense requests the scheduling of a trial date in January. 
The Court informs the parties that this case will be assigned to Branch II as of January.
recess 10:26am

NEXT:   (1) Status Conference on October 20th at 10:30am,  (2) FSSC on January 5th at 2:30pm,  (3) Jury Trial on January 9th at 8:15am

Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Amended Bond.

[MK] case called at 9:21am 
Defendant Matthew L Brennecke in court with Attorney Gregg Novack. DA Student Intern Haley Shelton, under the supervision of ADA Theresa A Beck, appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Brennecke waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment: 
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.

On the Defense Motion to Modify Bond: 
--arguments are given by Attorney Novack, by Intern Shelton
--a statement is made by Victim 1 requesting that the Court allow contact 
--the Court grants the Motion; the Court modifies the $5,000 Signature Bond conditions to now be:  
----no acts or threats of violence
----no violent contact with Victim 1 
---no discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1
recess 9:34am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on August 24th at 10:40am, (2) Status Conference on September 8th at 9:30am
Court's Response to Defense Counsel Bail Modification

Motion hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 10:00 AM 
Defendant Matthew L Brennecke in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance-- Victim present in courtroom.

The Court reviews Atty Novack's 6/6/22 submission
ADA Beck is hesitant to take action without Defense Counsel being present. 

The Court adjourns proceedings.

recess: 10:05am 
NEXT: Preliminary Heaing and Motion Hearing on 7/22/22 at 9:00am
Defense request to modify bail and adjournment of preliminary hearing

Motion hearing on June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[MK; the appearance of Attorney Novack is by Zoom Conference] 
case called at 2:29pm 
Defendant Matthew L Brennecke in court.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appears by Zoom videoconference. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.  
Attorney Novack requests the scheduling of a preliminary hearing.  Attorney Novack requests modification of the condition of Bond that prohibits contact with Victim 1; the proposed amendment would be to a condition of no violent contact with Victim 1.
Victim 1 is present and makes a statement requesting contact.  
ADA Teuber indicates that the State was not aware of the Defense intent to request modification of Bond; the State requests that the Court hear this request at a later hearing.  
The Court schedules the matter for June 7th, indicating that counsel may submit a stipulation for amendment of Bond to the Court for its consideration.  
recess 2:39pm 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing and Motion Hearing (further hearing on the Defense request to modify bond) on the on June 7th 10:00am

[MK] case called at 1:52pm 
Defendant Matthew L Brennecke appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.
The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1 
--no contact with Witness 1
--no presence at Victim 1's residence 
recess 2:00pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on May 11th at 1:40pm   (2) Preliminary Hearing on June 24th at 8:30am
